facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in their titles, abstracts, or keywords changed over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset, and how do they relate to the research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author affiliations
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';').explode()
affiliation_counts = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the most common author affiliations
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in affiliation_counts.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in their titles, abstracts, or keywords changed over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset, and how do they relate to the research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author affiliations
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';').explode()
affiliation_counts = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the most common author affiliations
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in affiliation_counts.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in their titles, abstracts, or keywords changed over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset, and how do they relate to the research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author affiliations
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';').explode()
affiliation_counts = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the most common author affiliations
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in affiliation_counts.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in their titles, abstracts, or keywords changed over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset, and how do they relate to the research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author affiliations
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';').explode()
affiliation_counts = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the most common author affiliations
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in affiliation_counts.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in their titles, abstracts, or keywords changed over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset, and how do they relate to the research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author affiliations
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';').explode()
affiliation_counts = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the most common author affiliations
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in affiliation_counts.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What is the relationship between the citation count of papers and the author affiliations, particularly focusing on the most common affiliations such as Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers with affiliations of interest
affiliations_of_interest = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
filtered_df = df[df['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest), na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count for each affiliation
average_citations = filtered_df.groupby('AuthorAffiliation')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter for the affiliations of interest
average_citations = average_citations[average_citations['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest))]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
for index, row in average_citations.iterrows():
    print(f"Affiliation: {row['AuthorAffiliation']}, Average Citation Count: {row['CitationCount_CrossRef']:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in their titles, abstracts, or keywords changed over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset, and how do they relate to the research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author affiliations
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';').explode()
affiliation_counts = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the most common author affiliations
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in affiliation_counts.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What is the relationship between the citation count of papers and the author affiliations, particularly focusing on the most common affiliations such as Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers with affiliations of interest
affiliations_of_interest = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
filtered_df = df[df['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest), na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count for each affiliation
average_citations = filtered_df.groupby('AuthorAffiliation')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter for the affiliations of interest
average_citations = average_citations[average_citations['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest))]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
for index, row in average_citations.iterrows():
    print(f"Affiliation: {row['AuthorAffiliation']}, Average Citation Count: {row['CitationCount_CrossRef']:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What is the relationship between the citation count of papers and the author affiliations, particularly focusing on the most common affiliations such as Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers with affiliations of interest
affiliations_of_interest = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
filtered_df = df[df['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest), na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count for each affiliation
average_citations = filtered_df.groupby('AuthorAffiliation')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter for the affiliations of interest
average_citations = average_citations[average_citations['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest))]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
for index, row in average_citations.iterrows():
    print(f"Affiliation: {row['AuthorAffiliation']}, Average Citation Count: {row['CitationCount_CrossRef']:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in their titles, abstracts, or keywords changed over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset, and how do they relate to the research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author affiliations
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';').explode()
affiliation_counts = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the most common author affiliations
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in affiliation_counts.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What is the relationship between the citation count of papers and the author affiliations, particularly focusing on the most common affiliations such as Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers with affiliations of interest
affiliations_of_interest = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
filtered_df = df[df['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest), na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count for each affiliation
average_citations = filtered_df.groupby('AuthorAffiliation')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter for the affiliations of interest
average_citations = average_citations[average_citations['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest))]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
for index, row in average_citations.iterrows():
    print(f"Affiliation: {row['AuthorAffiliation']}, Average Citation Count: {row['CitationCount_CrossRef']:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in their titles, abstracts, or keywords changed over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers mentioning 'sensemaking' in Title, Abstract, or AuthorKeywords
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False) |
                    df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of papers per year
yearly_counts = df_sensemaking['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
yearly_counts.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6), color='skyblue')
plt.title('Frequency of Papers Mentioning "Sensemaking" Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with papers mentioning 'sensemaking': {list(yearly_counts.index)}")
print(f"Number of papers per year: {list(yearly_counts.values)}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset, and how do they relate to the research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author affiliations
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';').explode()
affiliation_counts = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the most common author affiliations
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in affiliation_counts.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What is the relationship between the citation count of papers and the author affiliations, particularly focusing on the most common affiliations such as Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050336/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers with affiliations of interest
affiliations_of_interest = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
filtered_df = df[df['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest), na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count for each affiliation
average_citations = filtered_df.groupby('AuthorAffiliation')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter for the affiliations of interest
average_citations = average_citations[average_citations['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(affiliations_of_interest))]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
for index, row in average_citations.iterrows():
    print(f"Affiliation: {row['AuthorAffiliation']}, Average Citation Count: {row['CitationCount_CrossRef']:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")
